fs.fibu2.data.format
Class Fsfibu1Converter

java.lang.Object
  fs.fibu2.data.format.Fsfibu1Converter

public class Fsfibu1Converter
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides static methods for converting an fsfibu1 xml document to an fsfibu2 journal and vice versa. This implementation is static, i.e. if at any time in the future the fsfibu1 xml specification would change, this might not work.

Author:
Simon Hampe

Method Detail

convertFsfibu1Journal

public static Journal convertFsfibu1Journal(org.dom4j.Document d)
                                     throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                            java.io.IOException
Converts an xml document containing an fsfibu1 journal into an fsfibu2 journal. The conversion works as follows:
- Bank and Kasse startvalues are considered as bank_account and cash_box start values
- All entries are either bank_account or cash_box entries
- All Messpunkte are imported as ReadingPoints with their name and the date.
- The currency of each entry is EUR
- Account information for bank_account and cash_box will be inserted appropriately, coming from the fields 'rnummer', 'auszug'
- The field 'echtdatum' and the attribute 'uid' are ignored
- The category is derived from the fields 'kategorie' (level 1) and 'gruppe' (level 2). If the respective strings are empty, a "-" is inserted
- the fields 'name', 'wert', 'info' are interpreted as 'name', 'value', 'additionalinformation'
*

Parameters:
d - The XML document containing the journal
Returns:
The converted journal
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - - If the schema file necessary for validation of d cannot be loaded or d == null
java.io.IOException - - If an I/O-error occurs

convertToOldJournal

public static org.dom4j.Document convertToOldJournal(Journal j)
                                              throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Converts a journal into a valid fsfibu1 journal XML document. The conversion takes place in the following way:
- Only start values for "bank_account" and "cash_box" are adopted.
- All reading points are adopted
- The entry fields name, value, date, additionalInformation are adopted in the obvious way
- The entry field currency is ignored
- The field 'echtdatum' is filled with the same value as the 'datum' field - Only the first two levels of each category are adopted as 'Kategorie' and 'Gruppe', all further information is lost
- Each entry, whose account is not "bank_account" or "cash_box" or for whose account no mapping is given, is ignored
- For "bank_account" and "cash_box", all accountinformation is adopted in the obvious way. All further account information is lost

Parameters:
j - The journal to convert. Must not be null
Returns:
The document for the converted journal
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - - If j == null
